thread.title: UGA gets final letter of intent among commits
thread.title_full: UGA gets final letter of intent among commits

title: UGA gets final letter of intent among commits
text:
UGA gets final letter of intent among commits All of Georgia's commitments have officially joined the 2017 class by signing their letters of intent.   
ATHENS, Ga. -- Georgia has confirmed receipt of Westlake linebacker Jaden Hunter 's National Letter of Intent, making him the final Bulldog commitment of the day to make it official. 
UGA came into the day with 23 commitments with six having enrolled already. That left the Bulldogs with 17 commitments left to sign. All have done so plus UGA added a pair of defensive backs on Wednesday morning in Eric Stokes (Eastside) and Ameer Speed (Sandalwood; Jacksonville, Fla.), both of whom have been confirmed by the school. Not a member? For a limited time, buy one month of Dawgs247 VIP, get two months FREE! 
While Hunter was the final letter of intent to be confirmed by UGA, there was never any concerned about whether or not he would sign. The four-star linebacker is a double UGA legacy with his mother, Brandi Decker-Hunter playing basketball in Athens and his father, the late Brice Hunter, playing football. 
Hunter is ranked as the nation's 137th overall prospect and as the ninth outside linebacker according to the industry-generated 247Sports Composite. He's also seen as the 13th overall prospect in Georgia. 
His letter of intent, however, may not be the last one the Bulldogs receive. Mater Academy (Hialeah, Fla.) defensive back Latavious Brini , Grayson defensive back Jamyest Williams , and Clay-Chalkville (Pinson, Ala.) wide receiver Nico Collins are still on the board. 247Sports National Writer Ryan Bartow is also reporting that the Bulldogs may be a late player for Sebastian River (Sebastian, Fla.) defensive end Jarez Parks . 
(What's next for the Bulldogs? Make sure you're in the loop -- take a few moments to sign up for our FREE Bulldogs Newsletter! )
